snippet: The new offensive coordinator, Ben McAdoo, said Eli Manning and the rest of the team had made strides in the West Coast offense ahead of Sunday’s game against the Cardinals.
abstract: New York Giants new offensive coordinator Ben McAdoo says quarterback Eli Manning and the rest of the team are making strides in adapting to new West Coast offense; acknowledges widespread concern among Giants fans after lackluster season opener, but insists his players are starting to click.
lead_paragraph: The new offensive coordinator, Ben McAdoo, said Eli Manning and the rest of the team had made strides in the West Coast offense ahead of Sunday’s game against the Cardinals.

headline.main: Under Pressure From Fans, Giants Count on Eli Manning to Find His Feet
headline.print_headline: Under Pressure From Fans, Giants Count on Manning to Find His Feet
